etymologies: mid 17th century: variant, influenced by French déchaux, of earlier discalceated, from Latin discalceatus, from dis- (expressing removal) + calceatus (from calceus ‘shoe’)

definitions: denoting or belonging to one of several strict orders of Catholic friars or nuns who go barefoot or wear only sandals.
shortDefinitions: denoting or belonging to one of several strict orders of Catholic friars or nuns who go barefoot or are shod only in sandals
